Final Liberation.quote: When all the knots of the heart are loosened, then even here in this human birth, the mortal becomes immortal. (Katha Upanishad 2.3.15)

Ultimate Reality.quote: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End. (Revelation 22:13)

Divine Union.quote: The drop merges into the ocean and becomes the ocean itself. (Kabir)

Enlightenment.quote: The highest goal is the utter extinction of suffering. (Buddha, Dhammapada)

Salvation.quote: For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life. (John 3:16)

Paradise.quote: Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. (Quran 9:72)

Kingdom Come.quote: Thy kingdom come, thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. (Matthew 6:10)

Final Judgment.quote: Every soul shall taste death, and you will only be given your full compensation on the Day of Resurrection. (Quran 3:185)

Cosmic Dissolution.quote: At the end of the cycle, all beings enter into My nature, and at the beginning of the cycle, I create them again. (Bhagavad Gita 9:7)

Divine Purpose.quote: The purpose of creation is the realization of the Divine in all things. (Sri Aurobindo)

Ultimate Return.quote: Surely we belong to Allah and to Him we shall return. (Quran 2:156)

Final Peace.quote: The supreme state where there is neither day nor night, neither being nor non-being - that is the final peace. (Upanishads)

Eternal Life.quote: This is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God. (John 17:3)

Divine Rest.quote: There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God. (Hebrews 4:9)

Final Victory.quote: Death has been swallowed up in victory. (1 Corinthians 15:54)

Ultimate Transformation.quote: We shall all be changed, in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye. (1 Corinthians 15:51-52)

Cosmic Fulfillment.quote: That God may be all in all. (1 Corinthians 15:28)

Final Harmony.quote: The wolf will live with the lamb, the leopard will lie down with the goat. (Isaiah 11:6)

Divine Consummation.quote: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth. (Revelation 21:1)

Ultimate Freedom.quote: The truth will set you free. (John 8:32)

Final Unity.quote: That they all may be one; as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee. (John 17:21)

Perfect Realization.quote: When that which is perfect has come, then that which is partial will be done away. (1 Corinthians 13:10)

The City of God.quote: "Its builder and maker is God." (Hebrews 11:10, referring to a heavenly city) - Represents a final, divinely ordained dwelling place.

The Day of Judgment.quote: "For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each of us may receive what is due us for the things done while in the body, whether good or bad." (2 Corinthians 5:10)

The Kingdom of God.quote: "May your kingdom come, may your will be done on earth as it is in heaven." (Matthew 6:10) - Represents a future state where God's reign is fully realized.

The Event Horizon (Metaphorical).quote: "Now we see things imperfectly, like reflections in a mirror, but then we will see everything with perfect clarity. All that I know now is partial and incomplete, but then I will know everything completely, just as God now knows me completely." (1 Corinthians 13:12) - Suggests a point of ultimate knowing or encounter.

Eternal Present.quote: There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away. (Revelation 21:4)

Omega.quote: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End. (Revelation 22:13)

Pralaya.quote: At the time of cosmic dissolution (pralaya), all beings return to My primordial nature. (Bhagavad Gita 9:7)

Nirvana.quote: The extinction of all suffering is the highest bliss - Nirvana. (Buddha, Dhammapada)

Moksha.quote: Liberation (moksha) is the complete freedom from all bondage. (Vedanta Sutra)

Eschaton.quote: But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven. (Matthew 24:36)

Parousia.quote: For the Son of Man will come in his Father's glory with his angels. (Matthew 16:27)

Qiyamah.quote: When the Day of Resurrection (Qiyamah) is established. (Quran 75:1)

Apokatastasis.quote: Heaven must receive him until the time comes for God to restore everything. (Acts 3:21)

Tikkun Olam.quote: The repair and perfection of the world (Tikkun Olam) is humanity's task. (Lurianic Kabbalah)

Kalpa.quote: At the end of each cosmic cycle (Kalpa), all beings enter into My nature. (Bhagavad Gita 9:7)

Maha Pralaya.quote: The great dissolution (Maha Pralaya) where even the elements dissolve into primordial nature. (Bhagavata Purana)

Yawm al-Qiyamah.quote: The Day of Resurrection (Yawm al-Qiyamah) when all souls shall know what they have earned. (Quran 81:14)

Olam Ha-Ba.quote: The World to Come (Olam Ha-Ba) is better than all the life of this world. (Pirkei Avot 4:17)

Ragnarök.quote: The twilight of the gods (Ragnarök) brings both ending and renewal. (Norse Mythology)

Tzimtzum.quote: Divine contraction (Tzimtzum) creates space for return to unity. (Kabbalah)

Mahapralaya.quote: The great cosmic dissolution (Mahapralaya) where all returns to the absolute. (Hindu Cosmology)

Parinirvana.quote: The final nirvana (Parinirvana) is the ultimate cessation of all becoming. (Buddhist Scripture)

Apocalypsis.quote: The revelation (Apocalypsis) of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show his servants. (Revelation 1:1)

Fana.quote: Annihilation of the self (Fana) leads to subsistence in Allah (Baqa). (Sufi Teaching)

Telos.quote: The end (Telos) for which all things were created. (Greek Philosophy)

Ein Sof.quote: All returns to the Infinite (Ein Sof) from which it came. (Kabbalah)

Pleroma.quote: The fullness (Pleroma) where all is complete and perfect. (Gnostic Texts)

Kaivalya.quote: Absolute independence (Kaivalya) is the final liberation. (Yoga Sutras)

Eschata.quote: The last things (Eschata) shall be revealed in their time. (Christian Theology)
